definitions.definition: a heavy object attached to a rope or chain and used to moor a vessel to the sea bottom, typically one having a metal shank with a ring at one end for the rope and a pair of curved and/or barbed flukes at the other.
a person or thing that provides stability or confidence in an otherwise uncertain situation.
examples: the European Community is the economic anchor of the New Europe
synonyms: foundation "the anchor of the new coalition"

definitions.definition: a store, e.g., a department store, that is the principal tenant of a mall or a shopping center.
examples: noun: anchor store; plural noun: anchor stores

definitions.definition: an anchorman or anchorwoman, especially in broadcasting or athletics.
examples: he signed off after nineteen years as CBS news anchor

definitions.definition: moor (a ship) to the sea bottom with an anchor.
examples: the ship was anchored in the lee of the island
synonyms: be at anchor; datedharbor "the ship was anchored in the bay"

examples: with cords and pitons they anchored him to the rock
synonyms: fix "the fish anchors itself to the coral"

definitions.definition: provide with a firm basis or foundation.
examples: it is important that policy be anchored to some acceptable theoretical basis

definitions.definition: act as an anchor for (a television program or sporting event).
examples: she anchored a television documentary series in the early 1980s
